content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: variable_name
      operator: exists
    - name: variable_name
      operator: matches_regex
      value: /substr(varibale_name,1,length(variable_anme)-2\FN  /
    - name: --FN
      operator: not_contains_all
      value: ('Y','N','')  #check if null '' ok or if empty operator required
Core:
  Id: CDISC.ADAMIG.AD0006
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: >-
  'A variable with a suffix of FN must have a value that is not 0, 1 or null'
Outcome:
  Message: Variable with a suffix of FN does must have the value  Y, N or null
  Output Variables:
    - --FL
    - --FN
Rule Type: Record Data

Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: ADaMIG
        Version: '1.3'
        References:
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '6'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For subject-level numeric population flag variables':'' 0 = no (not
                  included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.  
                Document: ADaM IG v1.3
                Item: '5'
                Section: 3.1.4
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For character flags with variable names that end in FL and that
                  are not population flags, a scheme of Y/N/null, or Y/null may be
                  specified. As indicated in Tables 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.8.1, some common
                  character flags use the scheme Y/null. The choice of Y/N/null vs
                  Y/null is dependent on analysis needs. Y/N/null should be used when
                  N and null values need to be analyzed differently. Y/null can be
                  used when the need is to analyze just the Y values. Corresponding
                  1/0/null and 1/null schemes apply to numeric flags with variable
                  names that end in FN and which are not population indicators.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.3
                Item: '9'
                Section: 3.1.4
            
      - Name: ADaMIG
        Version: '1.2'
        References:
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '6'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For subject-level numeric population flag variables':'0 = no (not
                  included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.2
                Item: '5'
                Section: 3.1.4
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For character flags with variable names that end in FL and that
                  are not population flags, a scheme of Y/N/null, or Y/null may be
                  specified. As indicated in Tables 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.8.1, some common
                  character flags use the scheme Y/null. The choice of Y/N/null vs
                  Y/null is dependent on analysis needs. Y/N/null should be used when
                  N and null values need to be analyzed differently. Y/null can be
                  used when the need is to analyze just the Y values. Corresponding
                  1/0/null and 1/null schemes apply to numeric flags with variable
                  names that end in FN and which are not population indicators.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.2
                Item: '9'
                Section: 3.1.4
      - Name: ADaMIG
        Version: '1.1'
        References:
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '6'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For subject-level numeric population flag variables':'' 0 = no (not
                  included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.1
                Item: '5'
                Section: 3.1.4
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For character flags with variable names that end in FL and that
                  are not population flags, a scheme of Y/N/null, or Y/null may be
                  specified. As indicated in Table 3.3.4.2, and Table 3.3.8.1, some
                  common character flags use the scheme Y/null. Corresponding 1/0/null
                  and 1/null schemes apply to numeric flags with variable names that
                  end in FN and that are not population indicators.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.1
                Item: '9'
                Section: 3.1.4
      - Name: ADaMIG
        Version: '1.0'
        References:
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '6'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For character flags with variable names that end in FL and that
                  are not population flags, a scheme of Y/N/null, or Y/null may be
                  specified. As indicated in Table 3.3.4.2, and Table 3.3.8.1, some
                  common character flags use the scheme Y/null. Corresponding 1/0/null
                  and 1/null schemes apply to numeric flags with variable names that
                  end in FN and that are not population indicators.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.0
                Item: 9 (General Flag Variable Conventions)
                Section: '3'
              - Cited Guidance: >-
                  For subject-level numeric population flag variables':' 0 = no (not
                  included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.0
                Item: 9 (General Flag Variable Conventions)
                Section: '3'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Data Structures:
    Include:
      - ADAM OTHER
      - BASIC DATA STRUCTURE
      - OCCURRENCE DATA STRUCTURE
      - SUBJECT LEVEL ANALYSIS DATASET

  Subclasses:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: 'A variable with a suffix of FN must have a value that is not 0, 1 or null'

Outcome.Message: Variable with a suffix of FN does must have the value  Y, N or null

Citations.Cited_Guidance: For subject-level numeric population flag variables':'' 0 = no (not included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.

For character flags with variable names that end in FL and that are not population flags, a scheme of Y/N/null, or Y/null may be specified. As indicated in Tables 3.3.4.3.1 and 3.3.8.1, some common character flags use the scheme Y/null. The choice of Y/N/null vs Y/null is dependent on analysis needs. Y/N/null should be used when N and null values need to be analyzed differently. Y/null can be used when the need is to analyze just the Y values. Corresponding 1/0/null and 1/null schemes apply to numeric flags with variable names that end in FN and which are not population indicators.
